response.overview: In this atmospheric short film, Michael Jackson portrays a wealthy and tormented man haunted by the emotional fallout of betrayal. As the woman at the center of his heartbreak assumes shifting identities, the narrative unfolds as a meditation on deception, emotional disintegration, and the search for purity in a world blurred by illusion and desire. Through symbolic imagery (cards, mirrors, and fleeting reflections) "Who Is It" explores themes of love, loss, and the pain of uncovering truth behind the masks we wear. As moral lines blur and emotional debts come due, the story becomes a poetic reckoning, a portrait of what is lost when fleeting pleasures are chosen over true connection.
response.tagline: I can't take it 'cause I'm lonely
response.title: Who Is It
